page.title: 04THE HAMLET OF DUNFIELD
page.content: {Dunfield,}a collection of 15 houses sited either side of a narrow country road is on the edge of the {airfield} and about one mile from {Kempsford.} There are no shopping facilities but milk is delivered daily and a baker calls. This compact group of houses are either traditional{Cotswold} stone,with stone or blue slate tiles, or imitation reconstituted{Cotswold stone with imitation tiles. Of the occupants, one is retired, one is an artist and others commute for work to {Fairford, Cirencester}or{Swindon.} House names include "Dunfield House", "Waterwillows", "Forest House", "Rose Cottage", "The Cottage", "Brambles", "Poplar House", "Cox's Farm", "Cox's House", "Rickyard Cottage" (although there are no hayricks nowadays), "Spring Cottage" and "Cherry Tree Cottage".
